docs.lead_paragraph: EAST HAMPTON, N.Y. - Over the years, Hillary Rodham Clinton and Bill Clinton have been occasional visitors to the serene, breezy corner of East Hampton where Lily Pond Lane meets Georgica Beach amid the bayberry and beach plum. Sometimes they were guests of Steven Spielberg. But this is the first time that neighbors had seen them not as casual day visitors but as householders.
docs.abstract: Often guests in the area, this summer they put down temporary roots in a 1920 cottage. As long as there was power in the kitchen and phone service, Hillary said, they "weren't going anywhere."

headline.main: Clintons Hunkered Down in East Hampton as Irene Passed By

docs.snippet: Often guests in the area, this summer they put down temporary roots in a 1920 cottage. As long as there was power in the kitchen and phone service, Hillary said, they "weren't going anywhere."...

docs.lead_paragraph: Jean Houston, the woman who held several controversial consultations with Hillary Rodham Clinton, today corrected an entry in a widely distributed resume that said she had completed her doctoral studies in the philosophy of religion at Columbia University. In a telephone interview from her home in Pomona, N.Y., in Rockland County, Ms. Houston said she had completed all courses toward the doctorate and written a dissertation, "Tragedy in an Age of Skepticism." But, she said, the academic review committee demanded that she revise parts of the dissertation, and, she never did so because of disputes with the committee over some of her ideas and because her own professional life had become frenetic.

headline.main: Consultant to First Lady Admits Error on Resume

docs.lead_paragraph: A caption on Tuesday with a picture by The Associated Press showing the visit of Hillary Rodham Clinton to Bosnia omitted the identity of a man shown with her on a stage in Tuzla. He was Secretary of the Army Togo West.

docs.lead_paragraph: CNN had not been this excited since the O.J. Simpson verdict. It had legal experts to talk about strategy. It had political commentators to analyze the fallout. It had reporters stationed outside the courthouse to give live updates. It replayed footage of Hillary Rodham Clinton's entrance into the Federal courthouse in Washington every quarter of an hour or so.

headline.main: There Was Nothing to Be Seen But Coverage Was Extensive

docs.lead_paragraph: Irreverent “caganer” figurines, a Christmas tradition, depict celebrities and politicians in a rather rude position: squatting to defecate.
docs.abstract: What in the World column; as city of Catalonia in Spain prepares for Christmas season it welcomes new characters to traditional array of 'caganer' figurines; ceramic hand-painted characters, hidden in Nativity scenes, depict celebrities and politicians squatting to defecate in  homage to centuries old practices of fertilization; additional caganer figures for 2016 include Donald J Trump and Hillary Rodham Clinton.

headline.print_headline: On Christmas in Catalonia, Squatters May Be Welcome
headline.main: Caught With Your Pants Down? Must Be Christmas in Catalonia

docs.lead_paragraph: Katy Perry was the night's big honoree, but Hillary Clinton got the biggest ovation as the former presidential candidate presented the pop star with an award from UNICEF at Tuesday's Snowflake Ball.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sometimes it's the little things that bring you down. As Senate Democrats try to abort Whitewater hearings before the White House is forced to cough up E-mail evidence; as a Clintonite Arkansas prosecutor tries to block the testimony of the Independent Counsel's key witness against the President -- an unrelated cloud, no bigger than a woman's hand, appears.

docs.lead_paragraph: To show support for the soldiers her husband sent to enforce the Balkan peace, Hillary Rodham Clinton plans to visit American troops in Bosnia later this month as well as with the families they left behind at bases in Germany and Italy. The White House announced Friday that Mrs. Clinton would stop in Tuzla, the northeastern Bosnia headquarters of the American peacekeeping mission.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton to Visit Troops in Bosnia
